title: Harry Browne 2000 presidential campaign
added: On July 2, at the party's [[2000 Libertarian National Convention|National Convention]] in [[Anaheim, California]], Browne received the nomination of the Libertarian Party, receiving 493 votes out of a possible 878 on the first ballot.<ref name="Nomination">{{cite web |title=Libertarian Party chooses presidential candidate |url=https://www.cnn.com/2000/ALLPOLITICS/stories/07/03/libertarian.party/index.html |website=CNN |access-date=March 26, 2021 |date=July 3, 2000}}</ref> In his acceptance speech, Browne emphasized his opposition to the two-party system and the [[War on Drugs]], and his support for the [[Constitution of the United States|US Constitution]].<ref name="Nomination" />
